definition: to hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of, the act of obstructing or deflecting someone's movements
details:
verb
- to hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of
= example: to hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of
= synonyms: blockade, stymie, stymy, hinder, obstruct, embarrass
- to stop from happening or developing
= example: to stop from happening or developing
= synonyms: halt, stop, kibosh
- to prohibit the conversion or use of assets
= example: to prohibit the conversion or use of assets
= synonyms: freeze, immobilize, immobilise
- to shape into a block or blocks
= example: to shape into a block or blocks
- to shape by using a block
= example: to shape by using a block
- to be unable to remember
= example: to be unable to remember
= synonyms: blank out, forget, draw a blank
- to interfere with or prevent the reception of signals
= example: to interfere with or prevent the reception of signals
= synonyms: jam
- to impede the movement of an opponent or a ball
= example: to impede the movement of an opponent or a ball
= synonyms: parry
- to support, secure, or raise with a block
= example: to support, secure, or raise with a block
- to block passage through
= example: to block passage through
= synonyms: close up, jam, obstruct, obturate, impede, occlude
- to obstruct or stop
= example: to obstruct or stop
= synonyms: lug, stuff, choke up
- to stamp or emboss a title or design on a book with a block
= example: to stamp or emboss a title or design on a book with a block
- to shut out from view or get in the way so as to hide from sight
= example: to shut out from view or get in the way so as to hide from sight
= synonyms: obstruct
- to interrupt the normal function of by means of anesthesia
= example: to interrupt the normal function of by means of anesthesia
noun
- the act of obstructing or deflecting someone's movements
= synonyms: blocking
- a platform from which an auctioneer sells
= example: a platform from which an auctioneer sells
= synonyms: auction block
- a solid piece of something (usually having flat rectangular sides)
= example: a solid piece of something (usually having flat rectangular sides)
- housing in a large building that is divided into separate units
= example: housing in a large building that is divided into separate units
- an obstruction in a pipe or tube
= example: an obstruction in a pipe or tube
= synonyms: closure
- a metal casting containing the cylinders and cooling ducts of an engine
= example: a metal casting containing the cylinders and cooling ducts of an engine
= synonyms: engine block, cylinder block
- a simple machine consisting of a wheel with a groove in which a rope can run to change the direction or point of application of a force applied to the rope
= synonyms: pulley, pulley-block, pulley block
- an inability to remember or think of something you normally can do
= synonyms: mental block
- a number or quantity of related things dealt with as a unit
= example: a number or quantity of related things dealt with as a unit
- a rectangular area in a city surrounded by streets and usually containing several buildings
= example: a rectangular area in a city surrounded by streets and usually containing several buildings
= synonyms: city block
- (computer science) a sector or group of sectors that function as the smallest data unit permitted
= example: (computer science) a sector or group of sectors that function as the smallest data unit permitted
- a three-dimensional shape with six square or rectangular sides
= synonyms: cube
